name: The London NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to agree with all of the previous reviews. Considering this is one of the most expensive cities in the world, The London provides a relatively sane price with excellent staff, large rooms and perfect location. Our package included breakfast which was a varied buffet and quite satisfying. The staff goes out of its way to be helpful, from the front desk to the concierge to the doorman. One evening when it was pouring rain, we had only 3 blocks to walk to our restaurant for the evening and lamented taking a cab for such a short distance but didn't want to get soaked. The doorman heard our conversation and offered us the the hotel car and driver which was not in use at the time. He whisked us to our destination in short order, saving us from both wet feet as well as a cab fare. That is service! The concierge was always friendly and extremely helpful. The only downside to our room was that the huge 2 person shower did not have a door and hence the water poured onto the floor every time we used it plus there was a distinct lack of privacy if that bothers you! One other caveat is that the closet was also a strange design. Also no door, and angled oddly so that there was very little room in it. The decor is very minimalist which isn't particularly our taste, but the bed was comfortable and the amenities were fine, including 2 flat screen TVs, one for each room. AND the room the QUIET which for New York is a major plus! Would definitely return here.
reviews.title: Great staff, location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Allison K's review below summarised it neatly, having just returned myself from a five-night stay at the hotel: The London is a superb place, in a great location, staffed by a helpful team, and with two excellent restaurants nestled on the ground floor. We had a 500-square-foot 'London Suite' with a view to Central Park and all of uptown Manhattan. What a view! The suite was well appointed - my particular favourite was the twin wet-floor showers - and comfortable.
reviews.title: Virtually flawless

reviews.text: We didn't eat at Gordon Ramsay, but did dine at 'Maze', the other restaurant at the hotel. Dinner was top-notch. The service was a little haphazard, but the quality of the food made up for any minor slip-ups. The pudding was probably the best pudding I have ever eaten. Breakfast, also served at Maze, was very good.
reviews.title: Great Location - Beautiful Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, I would have no question recommending The London or returning there myself.
reviews.title: The London NYC Must See

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel in a great location short walking distance to all mid-town has to offer:
reviews.title: excellent hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I we stayed for 10 nights (approx $500 a night) during the month of October 2011. We loved the room, the location and the cleaning staff - cannot be said for the Front Desk and the Doorman staff. It was apparent to us after a couple of days that other guests were greeted with a friendly hello, how was your day - we noticed this because we had the experience of head down, don't make eye contact experiences on a daily basis. As a young couple, on the holiday of a lifetime in a very expensive hotel that we paid for ourselves we both felt that we weren't treated as other perhaps more older or 'serious' guests. I'm sure nothing was meant by it however it was plain to both my partner and I that we were not taken seriously as welcomed guests. I personally have stayed at the Waldorf Astoria, and other five star hotels all over the world and the London lived up to that in every other case except for our reception - I want to stress that no one went out of their way to be nasty, however both my partner and I were not treated equally - next time please don't judge a book by it's cover, if you hadn't we probably would have spent a lot more money on room service.
reviews.title: Had a great time and loved the room but.....

reviews.text: This hotel has found a way to combine Business, Pleasure and style. I always stay at the London when I am in NYC and this particular time was my Birthday. Upon returning to the Hotel from my celebration the front desk manager Heather noticed my flowers and dress and asked the occasion. When I told her she came around to wish me a happy birthday and sent up champagne! The bellman Adam escorted me to my room with my packages and was such a delight. They remembered my name and took great care of me the rest of my stay. This hotel already had so much to offer, but the staff makes it an invaluable gem to NYC.
reviews.title: Finest Hotel in NYC

reviews.text: Maze is great, and the rooms are among the largest in the city. Great location and service.
reviews.title: Among best deals in NYC

reviews.text: I stayed at The London NYC for 2 nights this week. As always, it was a great experience, from check in to leaving for the airport (really appreciated the doorman's umbrella as I found my way to the cab). The rooms are spacious, great bed and bathroom, excellent facilities, interesting bar, perfect location 4 blocks from the park. The staff has very high standards of professionalism and friendliness. Highly recommended. I am looking forward to the next stay there.
reviews.title: Great stay at The London NYC

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel are the rooms. They are spacious: entryway, living room, bedroom, closet area, and double shower. I have had large rooms in NYC before (e.g. the Four Seasons), but not at these prices (~$300).
reviews.title: Rave about the rooms

reviews.text: I stay at the London NYC about every three months for several days each time. The level of service is superb and the well appointed rooms are always spotless. The bathrooms/showers set new standards of convenience, practicality and safety. I highly recommend the London NYC to anyone looking for a comfortable Midtown location.
reviews.title: One of the Best

reviews.text: Stayed for 9 days in room 4510, thoroughly recommend the hotel. Concierge staff are amazing, bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in and all in all one of the best stays I have had in NYC. Will definitely be a returning customer
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in NYC

reviews.text: One of the very best hotels in New York. It is a very large hotel - although you can't tell from inside. Decor is art deco and theme is all about London - but with a twist. A few things that stayed with me from that stay...
reviews.title: Fantastic - but sometimes too expensive

reviews.text: The doorman read my name from my suitcase flag as I was paying the taxi driver. He had obviously seen my name and practised it before - as my surname is completely unpronounceable for most people...
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in NYC

reviews.text: The rooms where stunning. Apart from the awesome views (one wall was all glass) and the generally excellent quality of everything in the room (they are all suites), the bed... it was amazing. I still have to find a bed with more space and a better mattress anywhere in the world! Just an extraordinary night and fantastic sleep.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: The London is my preferred hotel when I stay in NYC. All of the guest rooms are actually suites, and they are not only spacious, but beautifully designed and decorated. The bathrooms are fabulous (be sure to ask for a room with a tub, those are few and far between) but even if you "only" get the double shower, you're still in for a treat. The staff are wonderful as well.
reviews.title: My favorite NYC hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Obviously since this is NYC you will pay for this luxury (I usually pay between $690 - $790) but it is definitely worth it.
reviews.title: Want luxury? Then this is the place!

likes.liked: — Size of rooms, location, level of luxury

reviews.text: We stayed at the London for 3 nights in August while on holiday in NYC.
reviews.title: Good... but needs a little more

reviews.text: Being from Australia we are used to spacious hotel rooms but the size of the rooms at the London pleasantly surprises us. they were HUGE! Lovely layout and great natural light with windows that even open for fresh air!
reviews.title: Fantastic
Phenomenal
reviews.text: We stayed on the 34th floor overlooking 6th/54th intersection. The hotel oozes luxury on every level - from the checkin to concierge to the turn down service and the gym.

The London is THE best hotel I have ever stayed at in NYC...and I have stayed at many. I am extremely picky about my accommodations (not very easy to please). I travel to NY at least once every couple of months on business and have chosen The London as my New York home. I cannot say enough about this hotel. The rooms are bright, chic and comfortable all rolled into one. The bathrooms are immaculate and perfectly designed and the service is unparalleled. You will want for nothing from these wonderful people. From the doormen and housekeeping to the management of the hotel...all have a kind word and a smile..making it truly feel like a home away from home.
reviews.title: I would LIVE at The London

likes.liked: — There is no single item I can single out - there isn't anything I dislike about The London
likes.disliked: — A point system would be a good idea...

reviews.text: We spent five nights following a cruise to Canada in the London in a Vista Suite. The standard check-in is mid-afternoon but we arrived circa 10am following disembarking from the cruise looking to leave our luggage until check in time. The concierge checked if there was a room available there and then and we were taking straight up to it and checked in.
reviews.title: Excelled all expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The attitude and knowledge of all the staff from the guys who get you the taxis, to the luggage porters , bar and restaurant staff,etc is superb and totally professional yet inobtrusive. The restaurant is excellent and the rooms really cool. The situation of the hotel is great as it's about 5 blocks (20 blocks is about a mile) from central park south and half a mile or so north of time square - all I'll say finally is myself and the family including teenagers cannot wait to return and we are not easily impressed - a superb hotel
reviews.title: I adore this hotel!!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for the second time as a birthday celebration with my boyfriend. We stayed here last year for my birthday and loved it so much that we decided to book again.
reviews.title: Trendy But Comfortable

reviews.text: In regards to the first time, we received a vista suite in the light blue scheme and it was excellent. The view was a building next to us, but what do you expect when you get a hotel room in midtown Manhattan?! As for the decor, I thought it was delicate and refined. It wasn't overcrowded with furniture and it didn't look busy or overdone. The bed was amazing and I also enjoyed the openness of the bathroom showers that were opposite of each other. All in all, great enough for us to book again!
reviews.title: great location, good value

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel many times and now as with so many properties, service is declining. First, they have started to spray some terrible scent in the rooms to make them smell clean. If you are sensitive to sinus issues like I, count on getting a headache right away. There was a minor miscommunication on my reservation and the front desk who usually realizes I am a frequent guest was very rude to my daughter who checked in first. Cleaning staff was loud as they were doing their work. Painfully slow service in restaurant...Gordon Ramsey would not be happy. WIth so many other choices in New York, I will try something else next time. Still great location and excellent room size but you can not get a cup of coffee in the morning unless you go and sit in the restaurant .
reviews.title: lost its shine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attentive staff, large rooms by any standards, amazing value for NY. Luther was great in getting my dry cleaning to me in no time. We are a 2 minute walking distance from shopping, 5 minutes from Le Bernardin, 7 minutes from Times Square. For a late night snack, try Ray's pizza across the street. There was a movie premiere right next door for "The Smurfs."
reviews.title: We'll be back this year!

reviews.text: The London made my NYC vacation spectacular. The accomodations were excellent - the room size, comfortable beds and beautiful bathrooms made for a spa feeling. The front desk graciously allowed our early check in request and the concierge was amendable to all of our needs, changing dinner reservations, finding theaters, getting cabs and any other needs we had. I travel to NYC for work and pleasure and normally stay at the Essex House right by Central Park - The London was equally if not better situated for theater, shopping, dining and out shined any other New York Hotel I have stayed at in the last decade. You must try it - you will not stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Only Place to Stay In NYC!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really good value for the price paid. We arrived very early but room was available immediately. Room was modern, cozy and spacious for a NY hotel. The bathroom was great with 2 showerheads, modern and very clean. The room was a suite with a separate living. The living could be more cosy but we hardly used it. The bed was very comfortable. All staf were very friendly. I have visited several hotels before and I will be back at this one, loved the whole feel of it!
reviews.title: Best we stayed in so far in NY.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose The London based on it's location in the city and because we wanted to live the high life in a hotel a notch above our usual budget.
reviews.title: Not cheap but worth EVERY cent...

reviews.text: The new London NYC occupies the old Rhiga Royal Hotel which, when it was in its prime, offered the largest and most enjoyable rooms in NYC. It slid, unfortunately, into a tired old property, to be taken over by the management of this slick, new, stark-but-oh-so chic hotel. It's all of that (if "all" is the right word), but comfort seems to have been left out for style. Sit in either the white leather rocker of the blue and dappled-gold sofa in the suite area, and you will slide off of both without grace or style. Look for amenties around the room (coffee maker? phone book? bottled water at bedside?) and you will be reminded that those are not cool to have in the room. While just about everyone on staff tries hard to make the experience pleasant, it nonetheless remains clear that there is not enough staff to go around. A 10-minute wait at the concierge desk is proof enough. Convenient mid-town location, but that alone does not overcome the shortcomings.
reviews.title: Just okay . . .

reviews.text: I have read a lot of reviews on this hotel and for those of you who did not enjoy this hotel - GROW UP! My husband and I got married in New York 2 weeks ago and stayed at the London. We had a fantastic time. The hotel was the best I have ever stayed in. The bed abd bed linen (egyptian cotton) were beautiful. We wanted to put the bed in our suitacases to take home!!!!! We stayed for 2 nights in a London suite on the 23rd floor.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — I really thought the hotel overall was fantastic

reviews.text: Some people forget what its like to just get away and chill. Who cares if the bathroom is not perfect or if the art is not great - just enjoy the break people! When you work 5 days a week be glad of the pampering you get in a super hotel like this. By the way the bathroom was cool and the showers were lovely and hot and the bathrobes were fab and the mirrors were great - is that not all a woman wants!!!!!
reviews.title: The Best Midtown Hotel

reviews.text: We ate at the Gordon Ramsey restaurant and it was beautiful. Food was exceptional. The breakfast was a bit overpriced but hey when your on hols who cares right.
reviews.title: Exceptional service - we loved the London

likes.liked: — The luxury, the location and the staff.
likes.disliked: — It's 4000 miles from home, otherwise we'd stay there a lot more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lifts work perfect - no creaking! Concierge was very helpful in helping us find specific stores in NYC, posting info home etc.
reviews.title: One of my favourite hotels
The good, the bad, the so-so
reviews.text: This was a real tale of two halves. On the one hand, I really liked the hotel for a number of reasons: nice location, cool lay-out, lovely large room; and on the other hand it was a disaster.

reviews.title: The high point of a family vacationFrom check-in to check-out
reviews.text: In brief, this was the first stop-off point on our honeymoon. Despite getting a good rate online, it was not cheap. On arrival, problem number 1: since neither my wife nor I had credit cards (we’re European, after all), we were told that we would have to stump up $500 dollars as a deposit. As we discovered at numerous turns during our stay, travelling to the US without a credit card is like playing golf under water – virtually impossible. After some negotiation, this was reduced to $250, and I would give the staff credit for showing a level of flexibility here. Secondly, they were a bit slow on the uptake regarding the honeymoon ‘treat’. Ultimately I simply had to ask whether they could possibly find a few strawberries and a bottle of plonk and have it delivered to the room, even though I’d mentioned it to desk staff on a couple of occasions beforehand.

reviews.title: My go to NYC hotel
reviews.text: The room itself was lovely, the cleaning service was great, I liked the little design touches around the place, and overall it was a pretty classy hotel. Some of the concierge staff were helpful with directions and tips. BUT, oh, a very very big but. En route from JFK, hassled and harried after the flight and with our exhausted baby daughter in tow, I somehow contrived to leave my wife’s mobile phone in the taxi. We realised the following morning and I spent the next few days frantically calling everyone – taxi firms, lost and found section at NYPD, etc etc – trying to relocate it. I had the driver’s name and even set about tracking him down. Lo and behold, four days later, the driver rings me at the hotel, and offers to drop the phone around, which he subsequently did (he had been away for the weekend, apparently). It was when I met him to retrieve the phone that he told me that he had been around to the hotel in the wee small hours on the evening we’d arrived at the hotel and informed staff of a missing phone, and if anyone had lost one, he had it. This was never relayed to me, despite me asking numerous staff members over the following days. I have no reason to disbelieve the driver, who, after all, may have dropped people to numerous hotels that night and maybe didn’t want to leave the phone at one without knowing for sure that that was where the owner of said phone was staying. So, in short: unforgivable. This, more than anything else, means that even though it has plenty of plus points, I don’t think I would stay at the London again.

reviews.title: great service at terrific hotel
reviews.text: From check-in to check-out, the London NYC was everything we hoped for in a luxury hotel and more. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful and the rooms were clean, comfortable and bright. (My wife just asked me to mention the yummy bed linens). Our granddaughters needed only one word to describe the whole experience: "Awesome." We are already planning our next visit.

reviews.title: Loved The London would highly recommend it
reviews.text: I have stayed here multiple times for business and can easily walk to my office at Rockefeller. The rooms are quiet; I have never had any noise problems thank goodness. Rooms are clean and modern. Service at front desk is great. The bathrooms are nicely done in marble. For NYC, this is a great deal for. It’s a big room for NYC standards – you get a desk and a small sofa! Only con is that I usually don’t eat at the hotel because it’s so expensive. But, endless choices of other places in walking distance to eat and drink.
Excellent design and location in Midtown. The best/ largest rooms I have seen in Manhattan. Excellent staff, great concierge. The bar/ public areas can not match those of other NY hotels.
reviews.title: Great rooms

reviews.text: Booked this a few weeks in advance for a girls getaway. It's difficult to find a hotel in NYC that offer two beds so I spent a lot of time searching. The London offered a two bedded room at a decent rate. I booked thru Expedia and printed my confirmation. Upon arriving at the hotel around 3pm, we were asked if we wanted a king or queen bed! I told the desk that we reserved 2 beds and that 1 bed was not acceptable as I did not want to share a bed with my friend. The manager was nice enough to explain that they have only a limited # of double bed rooms and there were a lot of families there that weekend (so be aware that you will not be guaranteed the type of bedroom you reserve). He gave us a discount on the room as it was too late for us to book anywhere else. Housekeeping was great at making the bed up with two separate sheets/blankets so in a king bed, if worked okay. They must run into this problem before as they offered to do this for us. Other than this problem the say was nice, room clean, new, nice bath and was quiet. The restaurant breakfast was good although very expensive (about $20 for eggs). Not my favorite location in the city as it's touristy, but overall may consider it again with my husband.
reviews.title: Very nice .. but some room booking issues

likes.liked: — Nice size suite, nice bathroom with double shower

reviews.text: I just returned from a 2 night stay at the London. I had stayed at the property several times when it was the Righa, so I was well aware of the hotel's terrific location. As for the hotel, the preceeding reviews seem accurate. There are very attractive common areas and the service seemed consistently good. The rooms are spacious and very nicely appointed, especially if you like contemporary decor. That said, our rate was over $600/night and the place is not worthy of that rate. If you can get an attractive rate, you won't be disappointed. Its a 4 star property in my view, so the nightly tariff should reflect that.
reviews.title: Good choice...if you get a good rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple final pros/cons: The fitness center is superb - one of the best I've seen at a non-spa hotel. The restaurant (Gordon Ramsey's) is flawed and very expensive. I won't go into details, but NYC has far too many great restaurants, especially for the price. Settle for drinks in the bar and go somewhere else.
reviews.title: a great Hotel in any standards
Great Hotel would definitely stay again!
reviews.text: The London is a great Hotel in any standards!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for an overnight getaway in NYC, which we do occasionally, and decided to try this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the concierge gave us a very good recommendation for dinner. While our room was spacious and clean, with a comfortable bed, we found it to be fairly nondescript and bland.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but not extraordinary

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location within easy walking distance of museums and attractions, and of course, Central Park.
reviews.title: great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you come across a good deal you won't go wrong staying here, but I didn't find anything in particular that would draw us back to this hotel a second time.
reviews.title: Awesome NYC Hotel -- highly recommend!

reviews.text: sorry i'm late with the review. just want to say thanks to the whole staff at the london. everyone was very helpful and very respectful. i had a great time and Fernando at the front desk was the best!!! definitely will be there again!!!!
reviews.title: We've been looking for a place like this for a long time

reviews.text: For NYC, this was a great value! For under $500, we had a gorgeous, spacious suite, comfortable bed, fabulous location on the south end of Central Park, and the service was fantastic. When I told the hotel we were celebrating our anniversary, they sent complementary chilled champagne and truffles upon our arrival. They couldn't have been nicer or more accomodating. We would definitely stay here again, and will recommend to our friends and family.
reviews.title: Perfect location, wonderful accomodations

reviews.text: It truly was a fab hotel and my husband and I are certainly going back!
reviews.title: Rubbish !!!

likes.liked: — Colin the doorman...great chap, very helpful,

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. The hotel is very modern and chic. The hallways are a little dark, but I felt this added to the hotel's calm ambiance. The standard room was a suite (I had a "London Suite"), with a full couch, flat screen TV, desk, and coffee table in one room, and bed and flat screen TV in the other. It was fairly spacious for a New York hotel room, but the parlor room would be small for a gathering of more than a few people. The room also had free internet, and an iHome iPod docking station, which I thought was a nice touch. The lights in the hotel room could also be dimmed, instead of being turned completely on and off. The bed was very large and comfortable and there was a great double-headed shower. The lobby was a bit small, with no real room to sit or hang out, but no one gave our large group any problems when we gathered in the hotel restaurant/bar. The bar was really great - probably my favorite bar of any hotel I've ever stayed at. Give the bartenders license, and they'll come up with some tasty unique cocktails. The food at the bar was alright, but room service for breakfast was disappointing. It was cold and missing some of the items I had ordered. Apparently the restaurant is much better when Gordon Ramsey is actually there, but he wasn't there when we stayed! The hotel is right in the middle of everything - convenient to anywhere you want to go in NYC. We walked most places - including to restaurants and a broadway show. All in all a sleek and modern boutique hotel, nice if you want a luxury experience and are trying to avoid the major NYC chains.
reviews.title: Great Boutique New York Hotel

reviews.text: We ve just back from a 4 days in NYC . We had a very good experience with the London NYC hotel. When we checked in the room had not the view I asked for. So the reception gave us with no hesitation a beautiful room with a view on central park from one side, and the river from the other. People at the reception were very nice. During our stay every morning we were asked if everything was okay. A good personnalised service .
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.text: We re going quite a lot to NYC and used to stay at the St Regis. For the price you pay at the London NYC it is worth staying there rather than any other hotel whih are much more expensive with smaller room and no view.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

likes.liked: — Location of hotel, Comfort of Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we were on Amex package , breakfast was included but not in the room , unless additional cost. But having breakfast in the dining room was ok, good fod, and good choice with nice staff.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a good quality/price I will recommend this hotel, with an excellent location between Central Park, and Times Square !
reviews.title: Don't waste your money

likes.liked: — 2 TVS, but one is really small like 15"

reviews.text: Stayed here with my family and in laws! we were 5 adults and 2 kids. Great rooms, nice showers and plenty of space for the clothes! Good cable! they have HD which for me is a big deal! I did not eat at the restaurant but my sister in law did and said service was not great! food was very good she said!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms are spacious and the valet and concierge do a great job!!!
reviews.title: Close to everything with huge rooms!!!

reviews.text: definitely one of the best in the city!
reviews.title: The London NYC

reviews.text: We just spent our 20th anniversery in NYC at the London. We are originally from the area and have stayed all over manahattan. We stayed in a junior suite as well as one of their "sky suites". For the price of a standard room at one of the more commonly "known" hotels you are treated to an apartment sized room...Even the junior suite has a seperate living room with TV. The room was clean and in great shape. The "sky suite" is over the top...It's like staying in a large one bedroom apartment in the city. giant living room, and a dinette set. Great views from everywhere. As for the proximity to all mid-town has to offer, this place nails it. Walk to broadway, times sq, central park, great restaurants, shopping...you name it. The staff was friendly and accomodating. They were quick to offer the hotel car to ferry you around as well. Gordon Ramsey (of Hells Kitchen fame) has one of his signature restaurants in the hotel...Honestly, we were a little dissapointed with the quality of the food there, but given that you are in Manhattan, the bar is a lot higher. We would stay there again on our next trip to the big bad apple.
reviews.title: Consistently Great!
My "Go To" Hotel in NYC
reviews.text: We stayed in a London Suite at this hotel 26Sept 11 to 4 Oct 11. We had NO complaints about any aspect of the accommodation or service. There we 3 of us, so the very comfortable rollaway bed in the lounge area was fantastic, the french doors giving privacy between the 2 rooms, even with the bed left out during the entire stay there was plenty of room for us to relax before dinner in the spacious area, gazing out at the streetscape and Central park.
The London has the best rooms/suites in NYC for the money.
reviews.title: Love the London

reviews.text: The most affordable room option The London Flat, has a wonderful siting area with mirror french doors separating it from the bedroom. Both rooms are spacious and have a uniquedecor with eclectic furnishings. The bathroom is huge, many with dual showers that offer optional shower heads.
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!

reviews.text: The location is perfect if you want to be near the theatre district, fashion district, times square and central park as all are within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: My number 1 choice!

reviews.text: Dining options are limited and menus are pricey.
reviews.title: Wowed me before I even stayed there!

reviews.text: With the great location and excellent room size The London is a perfect hideaway from the frenzy of NYC.
reviews.title: We loved it and we will be back!

reviews.text: I booked a London Suite for the Memorial Day Weekend (4 nights in total) and was very pleasantly surpised by the value for money of this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — The size and quality of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a suite on the higher floors that overlooked Central Park West, the George Washington Bridge and a bit of the Hudson River. The suite (a large living area seperated by double doors from a sleeping area) has free wi-fi, so I was able to dowload my favourite podcasts and play them through the ipod dock provided in the room.
reviews.title: Great location but far from perfect

likes.disliked: — Smoke on a non-smoking floor and the noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was comfortable with a nice walk-in shower with massive shower head (no bathtub). A dressing area seperated the bedroom from the bathroom.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - Concierge a Complete Joke

likes.disliked: — Concierge, Front Desk Staff and Concierge Again

reviews.text: The room was very quiet and because you can close the bedroom doors (to the living room), you can shut out the noise you sometimes get from most hotel corridors.
reviews.title: Good Show, Old Chap!

reviews.text: The location was fantastic - 1.5 blocks east from 5th Ave shopping, 1.5 blocks west away from Broadway/Times Sq, 3 blocks south from Central Park.
reviews.title: The London: solid 4-star value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed over the 4 th of July weekend and was very happy is all aspects. The sofa was a bad choice but the other features compensated for this. Great bath products, two flat screens, excellent bed. Loved the walk in shower. Our suite was on the end of the building and we had both front and rear views of Manhattan. Excellent mid-town location. We've stayed here many times before from the Righa days and this was the best stay so far.
reviews.title: Great stay over the 4th of July

reviews.text: We often stay at Four Seasons or equivalent properties, and the London NYC met or exceeded our expectations in NYC. Location is ideal (5 blocks from the Park, blocks from Broadway shows, great restaurants all around- you don't have to go more than a few feet!). Hardwood floors, elegant hotel, great beds, and quiet (we were on the 46th floor, right at the elevators, but no sound issue- still not sure why anyone has an elevator bell ring when there are only 3 elevators). Julie Andrews booked us, and she was superb- Four Seasons (indeed better!) service- great to work with and great followup, including just before our arrival. Front desk was good. Only criticism was the doormen, who stand around on the street and don't open doors or greet guests, but that is a nitpick indeed- that's how good the hotel is- when you have to go to this level of pickiness! We're tough customers to please, but will surely be back to the London NYC. Didn't try Gordon Ramsay's restaurant- we're fans of his, but hard to find something on the menu for teenagers!
reviews.title: Very impressive!

reviews.text: Planned a long weekend in NYC...partial work, partial girl's weekend and partial couple's weekend.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: Loved the hotel. A lot of room. Good ammenties. Excellent fitness center.
reviews.title: Large Rooms, Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was treated very well by the staff. Twice given use of the house vehicle.
reviews.title: Perfect
